snippet: A three-judge panel reduced compensation for a widow, now 69, who had won a court battle after surgery made sex painful, saying sex was less important after 50.
abstract: Portugal court ruling that reduced compensation for middle-age widow who was unable to have normal sex life after botched surgery sparks outrage in the country; reasoning behind ruling was that sex is less important after age 50, which legal experts say is degrading for the woman and violates country's legal and constitutional guarantees that sexual orientation and age will not be barrier to justice.
lead_paragraph: A three-judge panel reduced compensation for a widow, now 69, who had won a court battle after surgery made sex painful, saying sex was less important after 50.

headline.main: Sex After 50? Less Important for Women, Portuguese Court Rules
headline.print_headline: Sex After 50? Less Important for Women, Portuguese Court Rules
